meanings.definition: To take away or deduct (a number or amount) from another.
meanings.sent1: I will subtract two apples from the basket.
meanings.sent2: Remember to subtract the shipping fee from the total cost.
meanings.sent3: If you subtract the wrong number, the answer will be incorrect.
meanings.sent4: Her absence seemed to subtract joy from the party.
meanings.sent5: In math class, we learned how to subtract numbers to find the difference.

meanings.definition: To remove or reduce (something) from a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: We need to subtract the damaged items from the inventory.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to subtract salt from the recipe.
meanings.sent3: If you subtract too much, the balance will be off.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions seemed to subtract trust from the team.
meanings.sent5: The artist knew when to subtract colors to create contrast in the painting.
